jobs.description:
Adobe is seeking talented and passionate Software Engineer interns across all organizations to help plan, design, develop, and test software systems or applications for software enhancements and new products used in local, networked, cloud-based or Internet-related computer programs and products.

Adobe software engineer interns can work directly on products for our Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, or Experience Cloud teams, or they can be immersed in the world of our cloud-based platform - diving into components of our infrastructure or solving problems with big data. We have openings for all interests – web developers, mobile developers, data engineers, frontend development, back–end development, full stack development - the opportunities are endless!

What You'll Do

Develop high-performance, reliable, testable and maintainable code.
Participating in all aspects of software development activities, including design, coding, code review, testing, bug fixing, and code/API documentation.
Collaborate with engineers and participate in daily or weekly stand ups and meetings.
Grow with the support of your team and help others on the team grow by providing thoughtful feedback and uplifting those around you.
Work both independently and collaboratively within a fast-paced development team, with clear, positive, and constructive communication.

What You Need To Succeed

Currently enrolled full time and pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent experience required
Strong technical background with analytical and problem-solving skills
Previous related experience in software engineering (applicable coursework, projects, internships, etc.)
Proficiency and experience with at least one or more of the following: Java, C++, JavaScript, Python
Familiar with the software development lifecycle
Results-oriented, with ability and interest in learning new technologies

Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you'll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers who work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers' experiences.

Amazon Robotics empowers a smarter, faster, more consistent customer experience through automation. Amazon Robotics automates fulfillment center operations using various methods of robotic technology including autonomous mobile robots, sophisticated control software, language perception, power management, computer vision, depth sensing, machine learning, object recognition, and semantic understanding of commands.

Basic Qualifications:
Knowledge of computer science fundamentals such as object-oriented design, operating systems, algorithms, data structures, and complexity analysis
Experience with at least one modern language such as Java, Python, C++, or C# including object-oriented design

Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of programming languages such as C/C++, Python, Java or Perl
Experience with distributed, multi-tiered systems, algorithms, and relational databases
Experience in optimization mathematics such as linear programming and nonlinear optimization

We are seeking a motivated and technically strong intern to join our Business Systems Engineering team. This is an exciting opportunity to work on impactful, real-world projects that directly improve and optimize our current enterprise systems.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work closely with a team of 3rd party developers, delivering tech specs, answering questions, and providing feedback
Collaborate with BA's and the Business to help define problem statements and solutions
Design, develop, and implement software solutions that align with business objectives
Utilize object-oriented programming principles to architect scalable systems
Write clean, well-documented technical specifications
Create and maintain detailed technical documentation

Requirements:
Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Computer Science
Technical skills in object-oriented programming languages such as Java, C++, or C#
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment
A passion for learning new technologies
Excellent communication and teamwork skills

We are currently hiring an AI/ML Infrastructure Software Engineer at NVIDIA to join our Hardware Infrastructure team. As an Engineer, you will play a crucial role in boosting productivity for our researchers through implementing advancements across the entire stack.

What You Will Be Doing:
Collaborate with AI and ML research teams to understand infrastructure needs
Monitor and optimize infrastructure performance
Help define and improve AI researcher efficiency metrics
Collaborate with diverse teams to build a seamless AI/ML infrastructure ecosystem

What We Need To See:
BS or equivalent experience in Computer Science with 5+ years of proven experience in AI/ML and HPC workloads
Hands-on experience with HPC infrastructure, GPU computing, storage systems, and containers
Expertise in distributed training workloads using PyTorch, NeMo, or JAX
Proficiency in Python, Go, Bash, and cloud computing platforms
Passion for continual learning in AI/ML infrastructure
Excellent communication and collaboration skills

InstaDeep is a pioneering AI company at the forefront of innovation. We design the internship to focus on challenging applications where we can test our ideas and improve upon previous work.

Responsibilities:
Work alongside research engineers investigating approaches to solving problems
Investigate and establish performance baselines
Extend investigation with cutting-edge machine learning techniques
Research latest developments in the area
Be methodical about running and documenting experiments
Produce quality code using software engineering best practices

Requirements:
Undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or related field
Knowledge in and experience with deep learning
Experience developing and debugging in Python
Experience using deep learning frameworks like PyTorch, Tensorflow and/or Jax
Research and software engineering experience
Excellent communication skills in English
Work permit for internship in the US
Onsite 5 days per week
